page.title: 19Festivals in S.on A.
page.content: Customs. Each year on the Saturday nearest to Shakespeare's Birthday on April 23rd there is The Ceremony of the Flags and The Birthday Parade. Ambassadors and dignitaries from all over the world come to unfurl the flag of their nation.They walk in stately procession to The Birthplace and then continue through the town to lay a wreath on Shakespeare's tomb in Holy Trinity Church.Children from local schools take part in the parade and also put on a display of country dancing in the Bancroft Gardens. For two weeks in July there is the Annual Stratford Festival.The first event is the Grand Carnival which raises money for charity.Our school enters a float in the Carnival.We also enter poems in the Poetry Competition. There are many other events including plays,concerts,dancing,and fireworks.
